Parents- please be sure and read the “Remote Learning Student-Parent Guide” found on the “Return to Learn” page of our D105 website.
https://www.d105.net/domain/753

Includes the following and much more:
This fall, students will be provided a daily schedule that is comparable to an in-person schedule. Students will follow that schedule based on set class session times.
-All learning will be connected to grade-level standards and grade-level units.
-Teachers will formatively assess students regularly to determine critical prerequisite skills that
must be addressed to ensure greater success at current grade level.
-A combination of synchronous and asynchronous learning experiences will occur during the day.
-Instruction will be delivered through a combination of recorded teacher lessons, independent
application, engaging collaborative learning experiences with peers, and targeted student
instruction via video-conferencing.

Here is a link to a terrific article shared by Seventh Ave's Principal Mrs. Hall that gives tips about getting children used to wearing face masks. Click the link for the full article.
"Give them lots and lots of compliments for practicing and keeping the mask on for longer periods of time. Point out when your kids are keeping their hands away from the mask (instead of only commenting on when they are touching it). Once they’re more comfortable keeping it on, have them do fun things while wearing it. Do a silly dance, paint pictures, play their favorite games, or read their most-loved books. Practice putting masks on their toys, dolls, or stuffed animals."

https://blog.cincinnatichildrens.org/healthy-living/covid-19-tips-help-kids-wear-face-masks

Approaching Expectations (AE)
Insufficient Evidence (IE)

THIS THURSDAY - School District 105, which serves the south LaGrange, Hodgkins, and Countryside communities, will be hosting a preschool screening for children ages 3 -5 years old on Thursday, January 30th from 8:30 AM-12:30 PM, at the Hodgkins Park District, 8997 Lyons St, Hodgkins. If you know of a child in the District 105 area who would benefit from these services, please share this information with their family.

The D105 latest Strategic Plan includes the goal that we will: STRENGTHEN UNITY AND CROSS-CULTURAL CONNECTIONS THROUGHOUT THE DISTRICT. An action-planning team was formed and they have created a task force to study the issue.

The Task Force includes a parent representative from all four communities, two school board members, representatives from certified and non-certified staff, and administrators. This weekend, the team met with consultant John Krownapple. This consultant focused on "Excellence with Equity," one's own response to diversity and recognizing implicit bias. He helped the team understand the ways in which dignity is affirmed and denied across systems. Thanks Team! #TheD105Difference

-Fostering teachers' background knowledge in the area of student mental health needs.
Thank you staff! #TheD105Difference
